intro: Leontodon aureus, commonly known as the golden leontodon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in a single, showy head. The plant has basal leaves that are often hairy and linear in shape. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Leontodon aureus is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, where it is often found in sunny, well-drained environments.
